title: Starting a workstation session should not log JS errors by default
body:
A catch should be introduced to prevent showing the expected failure when all regions are tried:

Failed to execute 'postMessage' on 'DOMWindow': The target origin provided ('https://ca-central-1.grand-challenge.org') does not match the recipient window's origin ('https://eu-central-1.grand-challenge.org').

Do note: Firefox throws this in the grand-challenge console whereas Edge throws it in the CIRRUS console.

title: Add and update display set widgets incorrectly handle all interfaces as required.
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a Reader study (for example https://grand-challenge.org/reader-studies/cirruscoreweb-release-display-sets)-Cases-Add Case (single). The reader study needs to have at least 1 case with multiple interfaces.
2. Select an existing image for interface Generic-medical-image
3. Hit Save
4. Screen shows Unexpected error
5. Sentry event: https://grand-challenge.sentry.io/issues/3926657067/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved&referrer=issue-stream&statsPeriod=24h

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
It should be possible to add a display set that does not have values for all interfaces.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51329283/217807790-30c8a0db-f737-4366-9161-0ae7c5efcb79.png)

 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
 - Version [e.g. 22]

title: Failing partial update of display set does not return validation error.
body:
**Describe the bug**
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.

A partial update of a reader study display set providing a combination of images and annotations using the gcapi client does not work but also gives no errors. Although the reason that the partial update didn't work lies in the gcapi client, it is also a problem that the validation error that occurs in Grand Challenge does not get returned to the user. 

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
While fixing this [issue](https://github.com/DIAGNijmegen/rse-gcapi/issues/143), I noticed that the partial update call does not return any error if the request can't be validated. [This if statement](https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/663437267636baee52ce5705a94f863df95ecf79/app/grandchallenge/reader_studies/views.py#L1128) maybe needs an else?

**Expected behavior**
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.

**Screenshots**
If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem.

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: [e.g. iOS]
 - Browser [e.g. chrome, safari]
 - Version [e.g. 22]

**Smartphone (please complete the following information):**
 - Device: [e.g. iPhone6]
 - OS: [e.g. iOS8.1]
 - Browser [e.g. stock browser, safari]
 - Version [e.g. 22]

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the problem here.

title: Listing interfaces in archive update form does not work with empty archive items
body:
Listing the interfaces used in an archive (on the archive update form) does not work if there are empty ArchiveItems:

https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3455239880/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved

The same issue might be there for algorithms and reader studies?

title: Overlay Segments can be `None` in Question Update view, causes transaction error
body: https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3453755278/

title: Evaluations incorrectly marked as Failed
body:
When running an algorithm submission sometimes the evaluation is incorrectly marked as failed as not all of the jobs have been scheduled.

Also if an algorithm job fails other jobs will still be scheduled, there needs to be a guard in `create_algorithm_jobs_for_evaluation`.

title: Displayset view shows wrong widget for interfaces with super-kind File
body:
**Describe the bug**
Interfaces can be defined with super_kind File. For annotations this means that the annotation should be provided as a json file. For these interfaces, the "Edit display set" view in a reader study shows the wrong widget (JSON widget instead of file upload widget). This also leads to conflicting database objects: 

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/51329283/176149508-5f5efcda-b2c2-44ac-97bd-984eb77bbc16.png)


**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to a reader study with a question of type Multiple 2D bounding boxes that is linked to interface Regions of interest, for example  [this reader study](https://grand-challenge.org/reader-studies/cirruscoreweb-release-default-answers/)
2. Edit a display set
3. The widget for the default answer for the 2d Bounding box is a JSON widget.

**Expected behavior**
A file upload widget

title: Flatpages and Redirects broken when using ASGI
body:
Examples:

- https://grand-challenge.org/about/ (flatpage, exists)
- https://grand-challenge.org/about (should redirect to https://grand-challenge.org/about/)
- https://parse2022.grand-challenge.org/Participation (should redirect to https://parse2022.grand-challenge.org/Participation/)
- https://parse2022.grand-challenge.org/gfsdfgdfdsg (should redirect to https://parse2022.grand-challenge.org/gfsdfgdfdsg/, which should 404).

Error occurs in the clickjacking middleware:

https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3374906811/?project=303639&query=is%3Aignored

title: Algorithm output to stdout/stderr is no longer captured
body: For all recent jobs, the logs are empty even though I'm sure that the algorithms print something to stdout.

title: Markdown Editor jumps around too much
body:
When editing in Markdown the Grand Challenge editor jumps around a lot, so the writer loses their place.

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12661555/173570208-c2567b82-bb78-441c-9286-2f70a8f66745.mp4

It would be better if the size of the text area was kept constant, and the content only resized when switching to the preview tab, like on GitHub:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12661555/173570346-97f51fa9-fc23-49e8-b587-f656ff3cb7db.mp4

title: Update reader study question gives error
body:
**Describe the bug**
It is not possible to update a reader study question.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to any reader study that has answers
2. Click on questions
3. Click on Edit for a question
4. Update the question (for example Order)
5. Click Save
GC returns an error: "Something went wrong"
Sentry event:
https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3344966516/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved&statsPeriod=24h

**Expected behavior**
Question should be saved

title: JSONEditor fails to load for component interface in display set form
body:
**Describe the bug**
JSONEditor fails to load for component interface in display set form.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create a reader study containing a question where component interface field is set to an interface that is defined using JSON.
1. Go to the cases list view for that reader study.
1. Open a display set and click on edit.
1. The JSONEditor widget is not loaded for the interface field.
1. An error is shown in the console.

**Expected behavior**
JSONEditor widget loads correctly.

**Screenshots**

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2001094/172585070-00d0d4bd-b22d-476c-9b11-9700d9b16a5c.png)

See the empty space below "Region-of-interest". The JSONEditor widget should show up there. As the error in the console indicates, the following files (JSONEditorWidget dependencies) are somehow not loaded:

https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/5a193d8970a66cfd53617262414da90b1ab0b2aa/app/grandchallenge/core/widgets.py#L17-L19

title: Validation error for display set update form is suppressed
body:
**Describe the bug**
Validation error for display set update form is suppressed.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to the cases list view for a reader study.
2. Open a display set and click on edit.
3. Enter an invalid value for one of the component interface fields and click on save.
4. The changes are not saved because there is a validation error but that error is not visible to the user. It can only be seen in the network tab.

**Expected behavior**
The error is shown to the user.

**Screenshots**

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/2001094/172578489-353579cd-03e3-49d8-b5bb-fa2dd1d60b95.mp4

title: Challenge runtime statistics are not correct
body:
Looking at the Tiger statistics, for Segmentation and Detection (Final) phase:

Average algorithm job duration for Segmentation and Detection (Final):	25 minutes
Total algorithm job duration for Segmentation and Detection (Final):	4 days

There has been 1 submission to this phase:

![MicrosoftTeams-image (3)](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12661555/172356728-3c3656ca-cbf9-48e6-a886-29435e11e660.png)

Looking at a couple of those results they seem to take ~30 seconds each, and maybe 50 jobs. I think what is happening is that the algorithm was used for multiple phases, and there are different versions, which are inflating the runtime statistics.

title: Publications tests call out to external server
body:
There are at least 2 tests that make calls to external servers:

- tests/publications_tests/test_views.py::test_publication_object_visibilty
- tests/publications_tests/test_views.py::test_publication_creation

This is slow and they often fail (https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/runs/6771024533?check_suite_focus=true). These responses should be mocked instead, eg with https://requests-mock.readthedocs.io/en/latest/overview.html.

title: Creators of ground truth cannot answer a reader study
body:
**Describe the bug**
If an editor creates ground truth for a reader study they cannot perform the study.

**To Reproduce**
Create a reader study with cases and questions. Add ground truth. Open CIRRUS. Get told the study is completed.

**Expected behavior**
The editor can read the study.

**Additional context**
The `unanswered_by_user` block in the display set list needs to take into account ground truth answers. 

https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/0a84c04902222c2ca9cec00b5387e6bb3abf7354/app/grandchallenge/reader_studies/views.py#L1109-L1123

Teams discussion https://teams.microsoft.com/l/message/19:cd97152db8544ca1b74c6990e24ec446@thread.tacv2/1654173912687?tenantId=b208fe69-471e-48c4-8d87-025e9b9a157f&groupId=45c973c4-5543-45ad-a8b8-79ea596e6c69&parentMessageId=1654173912687&teamName=Research%20Software%20Engineering&channelName=grand-challenge-dev&createdTime=1654173912687

title: Reader study copying does not work with display sets.
body:
It looks like you end up with images set on the reader study again, and no display sets present.

https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/c68d359bcd23e45becdc1899e4e299859ed3e3ee/app/grandchallenge/reader_studies/views.py#L603

title: Reader-study display-sets with "unanswered_by_user=true" calculated incorrectly
body:
# Describe the bug

A very coarse explanation from the CIRRUS-side of things:

https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11632379/165755616-42fedc50-eb4c-4886-b686-ab977c97e6bb.mp4

More details: It seems that queries of the style: `https://grand-challenge.org/api/v1/reader-studies/display-sets/?reader_study=1e5946ed-46f8-4501-92fb-d85c91fa853c&unanswered_by_user=true` are affected. These somehow still return the already answered cases as valid candidates for answering even though they should not. This is also evident from the fact that the reader-study progress is not moving (I think - that might be a CIRRUS bug as well).

title: Adding of duplicate CIs to an archive item
body:
The set of CIs for an archive item should be unique. However, it is currently possible to add multiple CIV with the same CI for a single archive item. This is because the check to see if an a CI already exists and should be removed for an archive item is done asynchronously. So while the task to add a CIV to an item is queued, another task can be spawned to add another CIV for the same CI. This will result in both CIVs being added to the item so duplicate CIs on a single item. 

I'm not sure how to mitigate this issue. We could try to check the task queue (if that is even possible) before adding a new task to add a CIV if there are already tasks for that CI in it. Then the new task should be cancelled/not triggered. Because of the asynchronous nature it will then probably be impossible to properly show an error about this to the user. Probably there is a better way, but I'm not seeing it currently.

This issue is further magnified because it is not clear that an upload is processing when adding a new CIV to an archive item. When you add a file type CIV to an archive item it will redirect you back to the archive item list view. When the CIV adding task is still queued after you are redirected which is quite likely, you will not see any indication that it is in the process of being added on that page. Only when you check https://grand-challenge.org/cases/uploads/ you can see the upload session status. So a user could think something went wrong and try to add it again which will result in the issue described above. Maybe it is good to redirect the user to the cases/uploads page after adding a CIV so that they see that the task is queued.

title: Cannot resolve keyword 'name' into field.
body: See https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3186162930/?alert_rule_id=389098&alert_timestamp=1649749100615&alert_type=email&environment=production&project=303639&referrer=alert_email

title: Viewing of "file"-kind of CIV in archive items leads to 403
body:
I created an archive item and added a file type CIV but when trying to view the file it leads to a permission denied error. It seems that the permission check when serving a CIV file is missing a check for archive item viewing. It only checks for algorithm jobs and evaluations:

https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/9322d09c0859998a77accb5c13d6db675504a9c1/app/grandchallenge/serving/views.py#L94-L117

Permissions for archives are only done on archive level (vs. archive item level) so we need to add a check here to see if the CIV belongs to an archive item and if the user has the `archives.view_archive` permission for that archive.

title: Display set list view slow with a lot of images
body:
**Describe the bug**
The display set list view is slow when there are a large number of images

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. New reader study
2. Upload a bunch of images
3. Navigate to /display-sets/

**Additional context**
I don't think this is an N+1, but might be. More likely rendering all of the images in each drop down selection. If not an N+1 then needs moving to select2 autocomplete with appropriate permissions.

title: Add command to migrate case text
body: With the new reader studies the case text format changed. We either need to update it for users or find a way to maintain the existing API.

title: 'NoneType' object has no attribute 'values'
body:
Sentry issue https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/3127690895/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved

```
slugs = {slug for viewport in mapping.values() for slug in viewport}
```

Added in https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/pull/2322

title: Archive Serializers use `id` rather than `pk`
body: Some of our serializers use `id` rather than `pk`, for consistency we should only use one and that should be `pk`. Check the other serializers and see if this occurs elsewhere.

title: Hiding all phases for a challenge results in 5xx errors
body:
See title, hide both phases for the demo challenge and you will get a template error. Culprit in `challenge_topbar.html` where `challenge.visible_phases.first.slug` is `""`, results in a resolver error from `url`. ``` {% if challenge.use_workspaces %}
  •  Workspaces
    • {% endif %}
  •   Submit
  •   Leaderboard{{ challenge.phase_set.all|pluralize }}
    • ``` Users then cannot load any pages for their challenge to recover, so p0 but should be a small thing to fix, too late on a Friday night for me.

title: `add-repo` view only displays limited number of repos
body: The dropdown for selecting a repo to link to an algorithm from GitHub only displays at most 30 results. If a user has access to more than 30 repos, the repo that they want to link might not be there.

title: Unwanted item added in archives
body:
**Describe the bug**
Archives items always adds a 'corrField Configuration'

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Create an Archive
2. Click on `Add Cases`, add an image
3. Click on `View Items`
4. Add a regular overlay (e.g. Heatmap)
5. Go back to `View Items`
**Expected behavior**
Only the Heatmap is added and visible under 'View Items'

**Screenshots**
![corrfield_capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/7871310/135039131-f7085205-5828-4212-bfb8-7c8cb5490a5c.PNG)

title: Search is broken for Archive Items list view
body: To reproduce, navigate to `/archives/<slug>/items/`, type something in the search box.

title: CSL tests are flaky
body: The CSL tests call out to the network (arxiv and citeproc), which often times out. Mock those requests.

title: Add validation on REST API for no algorithm credits left
body:
When a user runs out of credits `remaining_jobs` returns a negative number, and then this is used to slice a django queryset. This then raises `AssertionError Negative indexing is not supported`. This needs to be handled, probably by checking that `remaining_jobs > 0`. See https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/2489707837/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved

We should also add a check to the REST API to return 403 if the number of remaining jobs are already < 1.

Not a blocker as still the jobs are not created, but, all the errors are not nice.

title: Algorithm jobs list page very slow
body: The async view for some algorithm pages is slow, only seems to be when there is a result to display as queued jobs are still fast eg https://grand-challenge.org/algorithms/mutils-10x-20x/jobs/

title: Modal is not dismissed after hanging list is regenerated
body: When a user clicks on regenerate hanging list for a reader study nothing seems to happen, but the endpoint is called. They should get the message (missing redirect?)

title: `create_algorithm_jobs_for_archive` timesout
body: Related to #1863, creating algorithm jobs for archives now takes too long and it times out. Doesn't look like its db limited from the RDS logs, but is making a lot of queries. https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/2280927696/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved

title: Not setting `USER` directive in processor Dockerfile fails silently
body:
Building a processor image without setting `USER` directive in Dockerfile will result in the container never being marked as ready and triggers a (silent) error in sentry: 
https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/2396054397/?project=303639&query=is%3Aunresolved

It should fail properly returning a validation error to the user indicating that the `USER` directive should be set in the Dockerfile according to docker best practices.

title: CSV export fails on converting uuid to json
body:
Problematic JSON structure in https://grand-challenge.org/api/v1/cases/images/redacted_uuid/?format=csv

```
{"pk":"redacted_uuid","name":"redacted.png","study":null,"files":[{"pk":"redacted_uuid","image":"redacted_uuid","file":"https://grand-challenge.org/media/images/...mhd","image_type":"MHD"},{"pk":"redacted_uuid","image":"09b3b3d6-0994-43d2-b6a9-eaff634b8805","file":"https://grand-challenge.org/media/images/...zraw","image_type":"MHD"}],"reader_study_set":["https://grand-challenge.org/api/v1/reader-studies/redacted_uuid/","https://grand-challenge.org/api/v1/reader-studies/redacted_uuid/"],"archive_set":[],"job_set":[],"width":596,"height":596,"depth":null,"color_space":"RGB","modality":null,"eye_choice":"NA","stereoscopic_choice":null,"field_of_view":null,"shape_without_color":[596,596],"shape":[596,596,3],"voxel_width_mm":null,"voxel_height_mm":null,"voxel_depth_mm":null,"api_url":"https://grand-challenge.org/api/v1/cases/images/redacted_uuid/"}
```

Probably due to trying to serialize the list of files to json in https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/14bc3dd4002756e9cf4a32bb0f238859a9175252/app/grandchallenge/core/renderers.py#L26-L27

title: Markdown preview fails CSRF validation checks
body: Caused by the name change of the CSRF cookie.

title: API schema has warnings
body:
In #1737 we added an OpenAPI3.0 schema, but we should go through this and ensure that the spec is complete, things I know are missing:

* [ ] The `CharField(source="get_*_display",...)` should be replaced with custom `ChoiceFields` that use the display values for their representations, so that we get enums for these back in the schema
* [ ] The Schemas for JSONFields with validators should be included in the top level schema
* [x] There are warnings where return types have been inferred, these are mostly correct anyway but need to be fixed, see the TODO in `app/tests/api_tests/test_schema.py`

title: Uploading a non-zip or non-text file to an evaluation does not change the job state from queued to failed
body:
Steps to reproduce:

1. Upload a container image as a method for the demo evaluation phase, wait until it is ready to be used
2. Submit a `.7z` file as the submission
3. The evaluation created will remain in the `Queued` state forever, it should be marked as failed

This occurs https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/a56fee78f605e957880a428c1698a1613af985ca/app/grandchallenge/evaluation/models.py#L611-L613

The associated evaluation should be marked as failed here (use `evaluation.update_status(status=Evaluation.FAILURE, stderr=f"{mimetype} files are not supported.")`). 

Whilst here, it would be great to solve this TODO: https://github.com/comic/grand-challenge.org/blob/a56fee78f605e957880a428c1698a1613af985ca/app/grandchallenge/evaluation/models.py#L589-L591

title: Image import job does not get marked as failed when the time limit is exceeded
body: Image import jobs should catch the celery soft time limit errors, mark the import job as failed and clean up before the hard time limit is reached. This is handled correctly for component jobs.

title: Public archives never filtered in list view
body:
As the `view_archive` permission is used to allow downloading of the archive the queryset for the list view is not constructed correctly. Add a new `download_archive` permission, and assign the `view_archive` permission to the reg and anon group as we do in algorithms and reader studies. Would also be good to add similar permissions to challenges.

See #1573

title: ChallengeList page should use pagination
body: This takes a while to load with many challenges and the Automated Evaluation boolean no longer works.

title: Verification field should be nullable
body: We need to represent accepted verification requests, rejected verification requests, and unreviewed verification requests. Use a nullable boolean field for this, with default None.

title: Cannot save phase update form without changing the title of the phase
Aggregation fails when many algorithm results are created
body: Causes ClientError, see https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/1945299773/

title: Images converted to tiff can get wrong image spacing.
body:
Images that are converted to tif files can get incorrect image spacing during conversion. Problem was found with certain svs files, where openslide found certain mpp propreties (micron per pixel) but these were not used to set the tiff tags ResolutionX and ResolutionY, resulting in these properties having a value of 1.

When used in algorithms that expect a certain image spacing, these images are then rejected.

title: First modal spinner on session detail page does not show on windows
body: On windows the modal spinner when the js is pinging the workstation rendering servers does not show up. Works on linux.

title: Products page loads JS twice
body: Reported in #1529

title: Participants cannot view their submissions
body: Check the permissions on the submission view page

body: ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1818749/92088381-12572100-edcd-11ea-92b4-f502e09520e7.png)

title: Invalid UUID error when saving a file upload form with incomplete files
body:
**Describe the bug**
When I upload my prediction files to the [KiTS19 Challenge Submission System](https://kits19.grand-challenge.org/evaluation/submissions/create/), it returns a "UUID list includes invalid characters" error.

**To Reproduce**
Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to [KiTS19 Challenge Submission System](https://kits19.grand-challenge.org/evaluation/submissions/create/).
2. Click on 'Choose File' to submit a zipped prediction file.
3. Click on 'Save'.
4. See error

**Expected behavior**
File uploaded successfully and enter evaluation stage.

**Screenshots**
![Screenshot from 2020-08-27 13-44-48.png](https://i.loli.net/2020/08/27/6c1kKemwqaDoT2J.png)

**Desktop (please complete the following information):**
 - OS: Ubuntu 20.04
 - Browser: Chrome
 - Version: Chrome 84.0.4147.135 (Official Build) (64-bit)

title: Test submission evaluation is flakey
body: This test is counting containers, remove that. Causes failed builds when run in parallel.

title: 414 returned from Decathlon leaderboard
error updating google scholar id of challenge publication
body:
![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/1818749/90975875-5b3ee800-e538-11ea-81d8-a5ba05c03dd8.png)

This is a strange error, but my proposal is to remove the google scholar id and citations editboxes altogether as we are not using them.

title: retina_api.tasks.cache_archive_data performs too many queries

labels.name: area/ophthalmology
labels.description: Relating to the ophthalmology workstation instance

body:
There is a periodic very high read load on the database, I've tracked this down to the task `retina_api.tasks.cache_archive_data`, which creates a lot of queries, and almost exhausts our provisioned IOPS when running:

https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/performance/summary/?project=303639&query=&statsPeriod=30d&transaction=grandchallenge.retina_api.tasks.cache_archive_data

Please use `select_related` or `prefetch_related`, in pytest you have access to the assert (max) num queries fixtures https://pytest-django.readthedocs.io/en/latest/helpers.html#django_assert_num_queries that can help with reducing this.

title: Limit number of emails when users upload incorrect data
body:
When a user uploads a 3D scan in DICOM format to an algorithm, each slice of the scan is usually a separate file. If the user accidentally anonymized the DICOM files too well, each slice might be treated as a separate scan and algorithms that expect 3D input might then fail - which will cause GC to send an email for each individual slice to all editors and the user, as happened [in this experiment](https://grand-challenge.org/algorithms/corads-ai/experiments/276d4375-e0ac-47b5-9950-34860319d5a3/). Several people received in this case over 400 emails because of one failed experiment.

In my opinion, GC could be a bit more conservative when it comes to sending out emails and could maybe combine all error messages of a single experiment into one email. Not a huge problem for me as algorithm editor, but imho it does not leave a good impression if users make a small mistake and are bombarded with emails by the system. An alternative solution could be to stop sending emails to algorithm users for failed jobs, not sure that is very useful anyway, but editors would then still receive all those emails.

title: Indicate that an image import is pending for an algorithm result
body: If the image import queue is full, algorithm results can show up in the results list with the note "No output images were found" even if the algorithm produced an output image because the import is delayed. This changes once the result image has finally been imported, but until then the user has the impression that the algorithm failed. It would be nicer if the results page would indicate that the import of the results is not finished.

title: Workstation Session create view always uses default region
body: Add a check on `Session.save()` if adding and region is None to set the region to one that is in use (or closest to the user).

title: Minio protected serving broken in development
body: In #1380 we removed the nginx proxy of the protected storage, which broke serving of protected files. This should be restored for development.

title: Cannot import DICOM with non-integer window levels.
body:
I think you can have non int window and level, please also check for the MHD loader
Dicom image builder: invalid literal for int() with base 10: '1906.5'

title: Large user container images can cause timeouts when uploading them to docker
body: If a user uploads a large container for an algorithm (several GBs) the first algorithm run will fail with a read timeout in `self._client.images.load(f)`. The user will get a report of "an unexpected error occurred", but subsequent algorithm runs will be ok.

title: Check if result already exists before creating job
body: Sometimes a job will be rescheduled in Celery that already has a result, these jobs should not be started and errors handled if a result already exists.

title: Allow null in annotation answers
body:
For string answers we allow empty strings to represent that the question was skipped.

For annotations and choices the front end skips submitting an answer if skipped, causing this issue: https://github.com/DIAGNijmegen/rse-cirrus-core/issues/635

So, we need to represent a question being intentionally left blank, and the way to do this is to add optional `null` (JSON/in the db)/`None` (python) to the schema for the non-boolean & string answer types.

title: Upload of Phillips tiff files fails
body: When uploading tiff files from a Philps scanner, there are a number of errors that occur while uploading. The files are also not shown properly by MeVisLab

title: Reader study answers mine needs to be filtered by the current reader study
body:
When CIRRUS launches it will query the mine endpoint to get all of the answers. For people who have a lot of answers, this could mean iterating over 10,000+ answers, slowing down the startup and causing errors when creating answers with new features: 

https://github.com/DIAGNijmegen/rse-cirrus-core/blob/aaa81af6a6fc606405d804f49e74c63b2b2515a4/src/cirrus/DIAG/CIRRUSCore/Modules/Macros/CIRRUSCoreWeb/CIRRUSCoreWeb.py#L1707

We need to offer a filter by reader study pk on grand challenge, and use that filter in CIRRUS.

body: Only an issue if the archive is using a private workstation

title: Zip of DICOMs fail with long filenames
body: In the zip unpacking the folder names are prepended to the filenames, which results in a filename being too long to store in the db.

title: It is possible to assign other annotations to annotation answers
body: The validation for annotation answers will accept any annotation, so it is possible to set say, a bounding box for a distance line answer. Discovered when reading code with @silvandeleemput yesterday.

title: `SystemExit` on retina api archives endpoint

labels.name: area/ophthalmology
labels.description: Relating to the ophthalmology workstation instance

body: As seen in https://sentry.io/organizations/grand-challenge/issues/1205791680/ and a lot of other sentry issues that have fired today, the archives endpoint is failing on something. It throws `SystemExit` exception and seems to fail on different lines in the code each time. Mostly somewhere during the building of the complex result object that contains all archives, patients, studies, images, and registrations.

title: MHD import errors are clobbered by TIFF import errors
body:
**Describe the bug**
If a bad MHD file is uploaded the importer will report an error and then pass the file to the tiff importer, which will then fail too and overwrite the error message, confusing the user. eg:

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/12661555/63936073-42a00d00-ca5f-11e9-967a-52f9f6b4e719.png)

These messages should be appended, rather than replaced.

**To Reproduce**
Upload a file that is not a MHD or TIFF

title: No reverse match for result-update on job list page
Uploading algorithms with a size of 5 GB triggers a 404 Not Found
body:
# Recipe

1. Go to https://grand-challenge.org/algorithms/
2. Enter some title
3. Attempt to upload a new algorithm of which the exported docker container exceeds a size of 5.5 GB
4. Wait...

# Result

After the upload finishes, you are redirected. Grand-challenge will timeout while generating the response. Nginx generates a `404 - Not Found`.

title: Preserve order of result columns
CKEditor Image upload makes the GUI undismissable
body: The browser keeps the changed fields state after the image is uploaded, and for some reason we're unable to dismiss the gui.

title: Tests will fail when alpine updates image label
body: When alpine pushes a new version of the 3.8 docker container the sha256 will update, and will break the SubmissionToAnnotationSet jobs. Handle this in a better way in docker.py.

title: Chunked uploads not attempting retries
body:
I forgot to implement the actual retry-portion for the jQuery file uploading. As such, jQuery file upload will only try to upload a given chunk once. See here:

https://github.com/blueimp/jQuery-File-Upload/wiki/Chunked-file-uploads

When using drag&drop to upload an algorithm, the algorithm upload widget does not auto-submit the form. Instead the upload button disappears, making it impossible to submit the form again.

Fix: repair auto-submit for drag&drop interactions.

title: CKeditor 5 swallows custom HTML
body:
Hello,
Thanks for all the fantastic work you put into this framework!

For [our challenge](https://continuousregistration.grand-challenge.org/), some pages use custom HTML for styling. However, when I now click "Edit Page" -> "Source", most of the HTML is gone and there is only the content and a couple of divs left. I know it is still in the database because the pages display correctly.

As a workaround for updating the page, I copy the code from "View Source" into a text editor, make my updates there, and copy the whole thing back into the editor for saving (and if I click "Edit Page" -> "Source" the HTML is gone again).

title: Challenges cannot be renamed
body:
If you rename a challenge, the challenge participants and challenge admin groups names are not updated, and you end up with a 500 error. The dropbox folder is also not updated. 

The group names are not case sensitive, the dropbox folder is. These can all be updated manually in the main admin panel by a superuser.

title: After google signin, redirect to last page is wrong (not using custom hostname)
body:
To recreate:

* Go to https://lola11.grand-challenge.org/download/ while not logged in. This will display "You need to log in to see this page"
* Click Sign in / Register button on top left. This will take you to https://lola11.grand-challenge.org/accounts/signin/?next=/download/
* Click the google button and go through the procedure there
* You are redirected to https://grand-challenge.org/download/ (without the lola11 in front) which does not exist.

title: changing project name does not work properly

milestone.title: Improve Frontend
milestone.description: Everything regular users see. Make it clear how to register for the framework, for a challenge, error templates, clear informative emails.

body:
Similar to #223. Creating a new ticket because previous one solved only the direct (crashing, 500 server error) type problem.  We should also solve the deeper problem

Which is: project name, in parameter short_name, is used throughout the code and outside the code as a key. Changing this key later on makes things not work. Everybody knows you should never use names as keys of course.. but this is the case anyway so lets solve it ok?

Items which are dependent on short_name:
- url for project
- file folder files are sought in
- name of permissions for admins and participants

title: Upload to /upload can fail if permissions are not set right
body:
I was just testing uploads for http://comicframework.org/site/VESSEL12/files/

And got an oserror because django could not write to the /srv/home/comicftp/Dropbox/comicframework/VESSEL12/uploads folder. I fixed this manually by setting persmissions in this folder to 777 but this seems a bit much. 

We need to check a few things:
- When upload folder is first created, does it get the correct permissions? (for example 776)
- Why is the folder owned by a different unix user than the uploaded file? /upload is owned by 1002 (comicftp) while newly uploaded files are owned by 33 ( www-data)

title: function based templates are deprecated
body:
function based templates are deprecated since django 1.3 and removed from django 1.5. Use class based views instead.
You probably want to use the TemplateView class in this case.

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/13442442/no-module-named-simple-error-in-django

title: New users via Gmail login do not get proper permissions
body:
Related to #129 : Users can bypass regular registration by logging in using gmail the first time. This way of registering does not require email verification, and subsequently, the signal which sets correct user rights for new users is not fired. 

This signal can be found here: 
https://github.com/comic/comic-django/blob/master/django/comicsite/models.py#L83

Make sure this signal is sent as well for registering using gmail

title: Admin permissions group for new site does not get permissions
body: So new admins cannot view anything in admin interface. Not good.

title: Serving files from /<projectname>/serve should offer for download by default
body:
Right now when clicking a link to download a file which has been rendered using the listdir template tag the browser tries to show it in browser. Meaning the headers are not set right. 

Set headers to always download

See

Re-create "new project" button

milestone.title: Version 1.0
milestone.description:
The first version of comic we want to go public with. Is functional and looks correct from the outside. Inside, the admin interface is usable but need not be totally streamlined. For admin, we do not need blogger-like security and hack-proofness yet. People with admin rights can be anyone in the consortium and trusted others. see 
https://github.com/comic/comic-django/wiki/Implementation-planning

body: this was there before, but should be re-instated

title: Username with spaces after gmail signin

milestone.title: Stable version: Crass
milestone.description:
No new functionality, just improving the exiting functionality so it can be called finished without hesitation. As proof host the CRASS challenge http://crass.grand-challenge.org/ on the comic framework. 

CRASS is a very basic project, only pages, downloads and sign up functionality. Hosting this challenge still means a number of existing features need to be improved and polished

body:
Bart had errors after logging in to comic with gmail. This was probably due the fact that his username "BartDe%20Dobbelaer" has a space in it. 

spaces in username cause trouble and should be avoided. See for example
http://www.comicframework.org/accounts/BartDe%20Dobbelaer 

The new users forms at both  /accounts/signup and in the admin interface do not allow spaces in usernames so the question is where this username "BartDe%20Dobbelaer" comes from. My guess is that the profiles creates a new COMIC user when someone logs in to comic with gmail when they do no yet have a COMIC profile.

Make sure no spaces end up in usernames

title: link is wrong in the activation email

milestone.title: Milestone 0.5
milestone.description:
Basic website up and running

Or more practically: Have an overview page which lists sites, sites are like this: http://crass.grand-challenge.org/

body:
When registering on comicframework.org the activation link is wrong. The site part is point to localhost.
In the mail template {{ site.domain }} is used. This points to localhost.

My idea is to properly implement the sites framework, then this will be automatically solved.
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/ref/contrib/sites/

Any thoughts?
